name: Hostel Lao

reviews.text: I spend 3 nights at this hostel with my gf and a friend in a dorm for 4 persons. In one sentence: It was a delight to be at this hostel, it is definitely the best hostel I have been in Argentina. The people of the hostel (owners, workers and the 2 dogs!) here were so helpful and nice with us. You can notice that the owners do not run it only for money, but also because they love to run a hostel. The hostel s extremely clean, the dorms, the common room but also the bathrooms. The drinks they sell are practically at supermarket prices. The only bad thing I can say is that the dorms have no closet to use with a padlock, at least not a good one. They have also on well working PC with fast internet. The swimming pool is rather small.
reviews.title: A delight

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My girlfriend and I stayed there for a Holy Week break and there's absolutely nothing to complain about Lao.
reviews.title: Couldn't have been any better!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: To begin with, Mike, Celeste, and the bilingual speaking staff make you feel very comfie, just like home or even better. They can arrange tours and activities for you and they also recommend bars and restaurants that aren't necessarily touristy, so you can count on honest information which is a big plus.
reviews.title: We've stayed in over 60 hostels on this trip: Hostel Lao has been our favourite.

reviews.text: The facilities were clean, not overdone with the typical hostel imagery, thus giving it an original touch, and there was a friendly atmosphere among all the travellers staying. In particular, our room also included air conditioning.
reviews.title: If Carlsberg made hostels....

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: In summer you can swim in the pool, conveniently placed in the beautiful backyard where you can have well priced beer or free wine from 8pm.
reviews.title: Best hostel in South America...

reviews.text: This is a really good hostel, mostly because of the generous and friendly staff. Everyone who works at this hostel will make you feel at home and do everything possible to make sure you enjoy your stay. Francisco, in particular, goes above and beyond the call of duty during a very challenging overnight shift to meet the needs of guests.
reviews.title: Amazing atmosphere; spotless rooms and facilities

reviews.text: Bathrooms are clean, information is plentiful about local dining and activities, beds are comfortable. Location is excellent -- just five minutes walking from the bus station so no taxis are necessary. What more could you want? Amazing hostel!
reviews.title: Free wine

reviews.text: I couldnt fault a single thing with Hostel Lao. Arrived at 6am and was welcomed by Francisco, who offered us breakfast, a great insight into what was on offer in Mendoza and of course free wine in the evenings. The beds were comfortable, the facilities clean and the general feel was very relaxing.
reviews.title: Amazing hostel!!
Great Hostel!
reviews.text: I stayed at this hostel in the beginning of April. The staff was wonderful and made you feel right at home. Most spoke great English, and were very happy to give you recommendations on things to do or make reservations for you. The place was very clean and had lots of extras like the organic jams at breakfast. The only two not great things I experienced were 1 - the activities being booked or cancelling last minute and 2 - the showers get clogged very early in the morning with hair so you stand in a puddle of water during your shower. However, these 2 things were so minor and the overall experience was one of the best hostel experiences I've ever had. The outdoor area is very nice and cute too.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stay for 1 night in a double room with en suite. As per the reviews below, the hostel was great. The best thing has to be the extremely helpful and friendly staff. We did the bike tour on their recommendation which was great and had a meal out at a local restaurant which was off the tourist trail. Unfortunately it was a little cold for us to experience the pool or garden! Breakfast was good and the room very clean and comfortable.
reviews.title: Best Hostel we stayed in in SA

reviews.text: I have virtually no experience with hostels, I tend to B&B or hotel, but traveling with my backpacking niece - what the heck. Well, did I get a lesson!
reviews.title: Will make you love hostels!

reviews.text: My niece and I stayed at Lao for our few days in Mendoza in early March 2013, it was a lovely space, and relaxed but completely focused on the keeping things moving smoothly and the guests satisfied. Pretty well all of the people/guests there were lovely.
reviews.title: Amazing garden and free wine.

reviews.text: On arrival we asked for the big single bed in our room be switched to two twin beds and boom, happened like a flash.
reviews.title: Spacious rooms

reviews.text: While we were waiting (it didn't take long), Mike gave us a rapid fire appreciation for just how fantastic Mendoza could be - and was for him, tuned us up for doing a bodega tour by bike and gave us the low down on the highlighted to-do suggestions they had posted, including The Vines, an amazing tasting place.
reviews.title: Like home

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Everything they suggested turned out well - the recommendation for Mendoza Winecamp's tour to Uco, the trip up to the Andes, the bike company to use, everything, they even helped us out with a local bus pass (and directions) so we didn't have to look for change (hard to come by small coins).
reviews.title: So enjoyable and relaxing we ended up staying a week!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It has been 3 years since I visited the hostel but I really can't say enough about the staff and owners. There is hardly a month that goes by that I don't think of this place and the people I met here.
reviews.title: Review - long time coming

reviews.text: This is NOT a party hostel, but it is a very SOCIAL hostel with plenty of good people, good food, and lots of wine. Good things will happen here on a regular basis. Thankfully, the owners don't put up with BS and if you have a good attitude the treatment goes well beyond excellent customer service.
reviews.title: Hummingbirds in the garden!

reviews.text: There are dogs on the premises but they were so well behaved and everybody loved them!
reviews.title: Don't look any further - this is the place to stay in Mendoza!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Mike & Celeste, we love you guys! Cheers, from Bruce, Vicky & Jack!
reviews.title: The best hostel in South America

reviews.text: This place has a beautiful inner courtyard garden - with a palo borracho tree that hummingbirds love. Lovely outdoor beds/hammocks to lie about in, very nice breakfast, and tiny but beautifully decorated rooms.  They also helped us with bike hire to the wineries and have free wine at 8pm - mmm. Only complaint was that one night people were talking and drinking in the courtyard til 5am, but I just put some earplugs in. Lovely place and very friendly staff.
reviews.title: Just amazing! The owners really care about your experience and its such a clean friendly hostel!

description: Hostel Lao is like a good friend's house where you can relax and meet people. Owned and run in a different style by English-Argentine travelers. For 5 years we have been welcoming travelers to stay with us, enjoy our home and see a more Mendozan side to the city. With just 24 beds to keep things friendly, chilled and clean; Lao is a traveler's oasis in the middle of a great city. A social, lively home, NOT a party hostel!
